definition: at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: American presidents' inaugural addresses (APIA) represent the characteristics of the typical formal address.
sentences.chinese: 美國總統就職演說代表了正式演說的典型特點。

sentences.english: American presidential inaugural address is a-sub-component of the public political speaking.
sentences.chinese: 美國總統就職演說是政治演講的一種。

sentences.english: Lincoln's inaugural address, brave and elegiac as it was, was speaking into a hurricane.
sentences.chinese: 林肯的就職演說，勇敢，祭文，因爲它被說成颶風。

sentences.english: She recited the speech, and Munindra recorded it .
sentences.chinese: 然後她念出就職演說，穆恁德拉把它錄下來。

sentences.english: Some of the best-remembered words of presidents came from their inaugural addresses.
sentences.chinese: 有一些總統的經典語句出自他們的就職演說。

sentences.english: Inaugurals mark the end of the presidential election campaign and the beginning of a new administration.
sentences.chinese: 就職演說標誌着總統競選結束，新一屆領導正式開始。
